column2: Role & responsibilities    Cataloguing and shelving library materials  Catalogue and maintain the library materials, Shelve, and organize books, periodicals, and   other materials. and ensure that materials are in good condition and easy to find. Managing circulation  Check books in and out, Processing the news books, and manage the library's circulation   system. Helping patrons  Help patrons find books, answer questions, maintaining the decorum of the library. Teach   them how to use the library resources. Administrative work  Perform clerical and administrative tasks, signing up library card holders. Other duties  Taking care of library assets. in case of any repairs of the same inform the concern   department.   Required Skills     A library assistant requires a combination of soft and hard skills to complete their daily tasks. A library assistant should have command on English, the ability to read, write and speak in English. Computer skills  Basic computer skills are necessary for a library assistant MS office & Operating System.   Knowledge of KOHA or any other library automation software. Communication skills and Interpersonal skills  To understand a task described by the librarian, and to interact with learners. To interact,   coordinate with fellow team members., negotiate, persuade, and instruct others while being   professional.  Knowledge of books  To have knowledge of various books, journals, nonfiction and various styles and genres is   essential.  Candidates with  M.L.I.Sc degree are preferred . Please send your CVs on below email-id hr@mitvpu.ac.in
column11: MS Office, Knowledge of KOHA

column2: Post: Librarian Qualification needed: B.Lib.Sc or M.Lib.Sc.   Experience: Minimum 3 years in a school as a Librarian Responsibilities of School Librarian  Creating an environment that is conducive to active and participatory learning, resource-based instructional practices, and collaboration with teaching staff. Create a curriculum plan and the classroom layout of the library classes. Plan and execute the classroom display and bulletin boards as per guidelines and checklist shared by the CO (Central Office)  Set up the learning areas by adding or replacing teaching-learning resources and materials in each of the areas as per the checklist and guidelines shared.  Coordinate and plan the Annual, monthly, weekly and daily curriculum plans and share via email and/or upload it on the server regularly.  Be prepared with the necessary books, classroom set up, teaching-learning materials before the class each day.  Issue books to the children, keep track and update database, do follow up with defaulters, submit reports on the issue and receipts. Conduct interactive classes with the objective to grow interest and inculcate reading habits in children.  Advocating for school library programs and the guiding principles of the school library upgradation, ensure cleanliness of the library along with arrangement of books in proper order. Share best practices (evidences and documentation such as photographs with captions, write-ups, observations, videos) with teachers, Section head, school management, CO team via mediums such as Teno, CR groups, School diary, Email and server.  Actively engage with children whilst in their learning centres/ play to promote learning through role modelling, stimulation and spontaneous dialogue. Follow the AKES,I Health & Safety practices to maintain a safe and clean work environment, and be proactive in matters of health and safety  Undertake other duties as assigned by the school management from time to time

column2: JOB   DESCRIPTION Job   Title : Librarian Reports   to : Management/Director Location:  CP International School, Farrukhabad, India Position   Overview:  We are seeking a dedicated and knowledgeable Librarian to join our team at CP International School. The ideal candidate will be passionate about promoting literacy, fostering a love for reading, and providing access to a wide range of educational resources to support the academic and personal growth of our students. Responsibilities: 1. Manage the school library efficiently, including cataloging, organizing, and maintaining the library  collection of books, periodicals, multimedia resources, and other educational materials. 2. Develop and implement library policies and procedures to ensure the effective management and  utilization of library resources. 3. Assist students and staff in locating and accessing information resources, providing guidance on  research strategies, and promoting information literacy skills. 4. Collaborate with teachers and curriculum coordinators to support the integration of library  resources into classroom instruction and enrichment activities. 5. Plan and conduct library orientation sessions, book talks, and other literacy-promotion activities to  encourage reading and library usage among students. 6. Maintain accurate records of library transactions, including circulation statistics, overdue  materials, and inventory management. 7. Evaluate and select new library materials in consultation with teachers, students, and  administrators, considering curriculum needs, reading levels, and student interests. 8. Manage the library budget effectively, monitoring expenditures, and seeking approval for  acquisitions and other expenses as needed. 9. Stay updated on current trends and best practices in library and information science, attending  professional development workshops and conferences as required. 10. Promote a welcoming and inclusive library environment that respects diversity, encourages  intellectual curiosity, and fosters a lifelong love for learning. Qualifications: 1. Bachelor's degree in Library Science. 2. Minimum of 2 years of experience working in a library setting, preferably in an educational  institution or school library. 3. Strong organizational and multitasking abilities, with attention to detail and accuracy in library  operations. 4. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to interact effectively with  students, teachers, parents, and other stakeholders. 5. Proficiency in library management software, cataloging systems, and online databases. 6. Knowledge of children's and young adult literature, educational resources, and digital technologies  relevant to library services. 7. Ability to work collaboratively as part of a multidisciplinary team and independently with minimal  supervision. Application   Process: To apply, please submit your resume and relevant experience and qualifications to recruiter@cpschools.in.
column11: Library Management, Reader, Librarian Activities

column2: Asian College of Engineering and Technology is looking for Asst.Librarian to join our dynamic team and embark on a rewarding career journey.     Collection Management:Assist in the selection, acquisition, and organization of library materials, including books, periodicals, multimedia, and electronic resources.Catalog and classify library materials using appropriate systems (e g, Dewey Decimal Classification, Library of Congress Classification).     Reference Services:Provide reference assistance to library users, helping them locate and access information.Instruct patrons on how to use library resources, including online catalogs, databases, and other research tools.     User Assistance:Assist library users with checking in and checking out materials.Help patrons with inquiries related to library policies, procedures, and services.     Information Literacy:Conduct information literacy sessions to educate library users on effective research and information retrieval techniques.Collaborate with educators to integrate library resources into academic curricula.     Technology and Systems:Maintain and troubleshoot library systems, including the Integrated Library System (ILS), databases, and other technology.Stay informed about emerging library technologies and contribute to their implementation.     Circulation Management:Oversee circulation desk activities, including managing overdue fines, processing holds, and maintaining accurate patron records.Assist in developing and implementing circulation policies.     Shelving and Organization:Organize and shelve library materials to ensure easy accessibility for users.Conduct periodic shelf checks and inventory assessments.     Outreach and Programming:Assist in planning and implementing library programs and events to engage the community.Collaborate with other staff members to promote library services.     Administrative Tasks:Assist in the development and maintenance of library policies and procedures.Prepare reports on library usage, circulation statistics, and other relevant data.     Professional Development:- Stay current with trends in library science and information management through professional development activities, conferences, and training.
